alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 8:56PM PST until January 31 at 4:51AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Tualatin River at Farmington affecting Washington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tualatin River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...Above 32.0 feet, expect flooding of numerous fields and low-lying farms, along with flooding of a few secondary roads in and around Farmington and Tualatin. Some farmland near the river channel will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 32.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM PST Tuesday was 32.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to slowly fall, falling below flood stage later tonight. The river will continue to gradually subside through the end of the week. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM PST.
